title: The Spanish Armada by Robert Hutchinson
description:
The victory of the English navy over the Spanish Armada in 1588 is one of those defining moments in our history, a shining example, so the story goes, of British pluck and determination to succeed against almost overwhelming odds. Well no, not really, says historian Robert Hutchinson in his revelatory new book. 

Instead he argues that the Spanish forces were defeated by a combination of bad weather, poor strategy and sheer ill fortune CHOICE Napoleon once called history "a fiction that men agree to believe". The Spanish Armada is a case in point, as Robert Hutchinson ably demonstrates in this cogent, readable account of the attempted invasion of England by the Spanish forces in 1588.

Genre: Non-fiction. History. England. Tudors
